sen.j: 問注所（もんちゅうじょ、もんじゅうしょ）は、日本の鎌倉幕府・室町幕府に設置された訴訟事務を所管する機関である。
sen.e: The Monchujo was a government body of the Kamakura and Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), which was responsible for judicial affair.
The Monchujo was a government body of the Kamakura and Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), which was responsible for judicial affairs.
The Monchujo was a government body of the Kamakura and Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), which was responsible for judicial affairs.

sen.j: 「問注」とは、訴訟等の当事者双方から審問・対決させること、あるいはその内容を文書記録することを意味する。
sen.e: The term of "Monchu"means to inquire the both parties of a case, confront them, and record the details of the case.
The term "Monchu"means to question both parties in a case, confront them, and record the details of the case.
The term "Monchu" means to question both parties in connection to a case, to have them confront each other, and to record the details of the case.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。“Monchu” のダブルクォーテーションを全角から半角に修正しました。

sen.j: つまり「問注所」とは問注を行う場所を意味する。
sen.e: Therefore the "Monchujo" refers to a place where Mmonchu" was held.
Therefore the "Monchujo" refers to a place where Monchu" was held.
Therefore the "Monchujo" refers to a place where the monchu took place.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。“Monchujo” のダブルクォーテーションを全角から半角に修正しました。

sen.j: 平安期には問注を行うための特定の場所は定められていなかった。
sen.e: There had been no specific place where "Monchu" was held in the Heian era.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: There had been no specific place where "Monchu" was held in the Heian era.
There was no designated place where the monchu was held during the Heian period.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 鎌倉幕府においては問注を行う場所として問注所を設置したのである。
sen.e: The Kamakura bakufu established the Monchujo as a place for holding the monchu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Kamakura bakufu established the Monchujo as a place to hold monchu.
It was the Kamakura bakufu which established the Monchujo as the place specifically reserved for holding the monchu.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 1184年（元暦元）10月20日 (旧暦)、鎌倉に問注所が設置された。
sen.e: The Monchujo was established in Kamakura on October 20, 1184.
The Monchujo was established in Kamakura on October 20, 1184.
The Monchujo was established in Kamakura on November 25, 1184.
sen.cmt: 旧暦を西暦にしました。

sen.j: 当時、日本は国内を二分する大規模内乱（治承・寿永の乱）の真っ直中にあったが、この内乱の中でも（又は内乱に乗じて）訴訟事案は多数発生していた。
sen.e: It was amid a large scale civil war (Jisho-Juei War) between two powers that the Monchujo was established, and many cases involving lawsuits occurred.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Monchujo was established amid a large scale civil war (Jisho-Juei War) between two powers with many lawsuits resulting at the time.
The Monchujo was established amid a large scale civil war (the Jisho-Juei War), and despite the war (or because of it), there were many lawsuits resulting at the time.
sen.cmt: 元の訳文の訳漏れを訂正しました。FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 非公式に発足した関東軍事政権（後の鎌倉幕府）にとって、これらの訴訟を迅速・円滑に処理していくことが、確固たる政権として認められる条件の一つとなっていた。
sen.e: A smooth and swift handle of lawsuits was one of the conditions necessary for the informally established military government to be recognized as a stable government.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The smooth and swift handling of lawsuits was one of the conditions necessary for the informally established military government to be recognized as a stable government.
The smooth and swift handling of lawsuits was one of the requirements for the unofficially established military government (later Kamakura bakufu) to be recognized as a stable government.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 初代問注所執事（長官）には、三善康信が任命された。
sen.e: Yasunobu MIYOSHI was appointed as the first head of the Monchujo.
Yasunobu MIYOSHI was appointed as the first head of the Monchujo.
Yasunobu MIYOSHI was appointed as the first head of the Monchujo.

sen.j: 三善氏は三善清行の子孫に当たり、代々算道を家業としていた。
sen.e: The Sando (study of mathematics) had been the family business of the Miyoshi clan--the decedents of Kiyoyuki MIYOSHI.
The Sando (study of mathematics) had been the family business of the Miyoshi clan--the decedents of Kiyoyuki MIYOSHI.
The Sando (study of mathematics) had been the family business of the Miyoshi clan, who were the decedents of Kiyoyuki MIYOSHI.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 康信は有能な役人として知られていたが、親類に源頼朝の乳母がいた縁もあって、初代執事として京都から鎌倉へ招かれたのである。
sen.e: Yasunobu, known as a competent government official, were invited from Kyoto to Kamakura to assume the first generation head of the Monchujo through an influence of his relative who working as a wet nurse of Yoritomo MINAMOTO.

Yasunobu, known as a competent government official, were invited from Kyoto to Kamakura to assume the first generation head of the Monchujo through the influence of his relative who worked as a wet nurse of Yoritomo MINAMOTO.

Through the influence of his relative who worked as a wet nurse of MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, Yasunobu, known as a competent government official, was invited from Kyoto to Kamakura to assume the role as the first head of the monchujo.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 以降、問注所執事は鎌倉・室町期を通じて三善氏が世襲することとなる。
sen.e: Since then, the Miyoshi clan succeeded the head of the Monchujo for generations during the Kamakura and Muromachi periods.
Since then, the Miyoshi clan succeeded the head of the Monchujo for generations during the Kamakura and Muromachi periods.
From then on, the members of the Miyoshi clan served as the head of the Monchujo for generations during the Kamakura and Muromachi periods.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: なお、『武家名目抄』には「問注所は政所の別庁にて、ともに政事を沙汰する中にも、訴訟の裁判を本務とする所なり」（職名部（ハ）上）と記されている。
sen.e: "Buke myomoku-sho" (Compilation of historical data of the Edo period) says (the name of office (ha) above) : "Monchujo is a government body different from Mandokoro (Administrative Board) but makes political decisions together and functions as a court of justice. "
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: "Buke myomoku-sho" (Compilation of historical data of the Edo period) says (the name of office (ha) above) : "Monchujo is a government body different from Mandokoro (Administrative Board) but makes political decisions together and functions as a court of justice. "

In the "Buke myomoku-sho" (Compilation of Historical Data of the Warrior Class), it is written (under the entries for the titles of offices of the first volume): "Monchujo is a government body different from Mandokoro (Administrative Board) but makes political decisions together and functions as a court of justice."
sen.cmt: 『武家名目抄』は(Compilation of Historical Data of the Warrior Class)と訳しました。FBに従って修正しました。ダブルクォーテーションを全角から半角に修正しました。

sen.j: 更に『吾妻鏡』建久2年正月15日条に書かれた職制においても、政所と侍所については行を改めて別当以下を記載しているのに対して、問注所については政所の項目の最後に「問注所執事」と1行で記されていることから、初期の問注所は政所に属する1機関であり、後に政所から分離して独立した機関となったとする説もある（佐々木文昭説）。
sen.e: Furthermore, in "Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East) wrote on 15 January, 1191, about the titles of office starting from bessho (chief officer) of Man-dokoro and Samurai-dokoro (the Board of Retainers) in different paragraphs, but it describes "the head of Monchu-dokoro"on the last line of the Mandokoro's paragraph, which shows that the Monchu- dokoro in the begining might have been a body belonging to the Mandokoro but later become a separate and independent body. (Fumiaki SASAKI)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Furthermore, in "Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East) wrote on 15 January, 1191, about the titles of office starting from bessho (chief officer) of Man-dokoro and Samurai-dokoro (the Board of Retainers) in different paragraphs, but it describes "the head of Monchu-dokoro"on the last line of the Mandokoro's paragraph, which shows that the Monchu- dokoro in the begining might have been a body belonging to the Mandokoro but later become a separate and independent body. (Fumiaki SASAKI)

Furthermore, in the entry about the titles of office written on January 15, 1191 in "Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East), while the betto (the assistant chief officer) and other officers of Mandokoro and Samurai-dokoro (the Board of Retainers) were each inserted at the start of a new paragraph, the "head of Monchu-dokoro" is described in the last line of the paragraph concerning Mandokoro, which may explain, according to Fumiaki SASAKI, that the Monchu-dokoro in the beginning might have been a body belonging to the Mandokoro but later become a separate and independent body.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。ダブルクォーテーションを全角から半角に修正しました。

sen.j: 当初、問注所は訴訟に対する裁判事務は行わず、武家棟梁である源頼朝へ訴訟事案を進達することを任務としていた。
sen.e: In the beginning, the Monchu-dokoro did not handle administrative procedures of lawsuits but convey to Yoritomo MIYAMOTO, the head of samurais, on what lawsuits were brought about.

In the beginning, the Monchu-dokoro did not handle the administrative procedures pertaining to lawsuits but simply conveyed to Yoritomo MIYAMOTO, the head of samurais, on what lawsuits were brought about.
In the beginning, the Monchu-dokoro did not handle the judicial administration pertaining to lawsuits, but simply conveyed to MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, the head of samurais, the details of lawsuits.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 吾妻鏡には、頼朝邸内の東西にある小さな建物を問注所と号したとある。
sen.e: Azuma Kagami describes that Monchujo were located in 2 small buildings in east and west of the mansion of YORIMOTO.
Azuma Kagami describes that Monchujo were located in 2 small buildings in the east and west of the mansion of YORIMOTO.
Azuma Kagami describes that Monchujo were two small buildings located on the east and west sides of the Yoritomo's residence.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 頼朝邸内に多数の訴人が集まり、怒号・喧噪が飛び交ったため、頼朝はそれにうんざりし問注所の移転を命じた。
sen.e: Disgusted with shouts and qrguments exchanged within his mansion, Yoritomo ordered to relocate the Monchu-dokoro.
Disgusted with the shouts and arguments exchanged within his mansion, Yoritomo ordered the relocation of the Monchu-dokoro.
Disgusted by the shouts and arguments exchanged within his compound, Yoritomo ordered the relocation of the Monchu-dokoro.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: その結果1199年（建久10）4月1日 (旧暦)、問注所は別の場所へ移転されたが、その直前に頼朝は死亡していた。
sen.e: As the result, the Monchu-dokoro was relocated on April 1, 1199, but he had died just before the relocation.
As a result, the Monchu-dokoro was relocated on April 1, 1199. However, Yoritomo MIYAMOTO died just before the relocation.
Although the Monchu-dokoro was relocated on April 27, 1199, Yoritomo had died shortly before the relocation.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: なお現在、移転後の地（現鎌倉市立御成小学校前）には「問注所旧蹟碑」が立てられている。
sen.e: For reference, "a historical monument of Monchujo" stands in Kamakura City Onari Elementary School, the site of relocated Monchujo,
For reference, "a historical monument of Monchujo" stands in Kamakura City Onari Elementary School, the site of the relocated Monchujo,
Today the "historical monument of Monchujo" stands in front of the Kamakura City Onari Elementary School, which was the site of the relocated Monchujo.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。ダブルクォーテーションを全角から半角に修正しました。

sen.j: 問注所は当初、訴訟・裁判事務全般を所管したが、訴訟事案の増加に伴い、次第に事案が滞り始め、事務処理の迅速化が求められるようになった。
sen.e: Monchujo, which at first was responsible for lawsuits and judicial affairs in general, became slow in dealing with cases because of an increase in the number of lawsuits, and thus speeding up the trial process was called for...

Monchujo, which at first was responsible for lawsuits and judicial affairs in general, became slow in dealing with cases because of an increase in the number of lawsuits. Thus an increase in the speed of trials conducted was called for.

As the Monchujo, which at first was responsible for lawsuits and judicial affairs in general, could no longer cope with the increasing number of lawsuits, much faster handling of the cases was called for.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: そこで、1249年（建長1）12月9日 (旧暦)、引付衆が新設された。
sen.e: As the result, Hikitsukeshu (Coadjustor of the High Court) was established on Decmber 9, 1249.
As a result, Hikitsukeshu (Coadjustor of the High Court) was established on Decmber 9, 1249.
As a result, the position of Hikitsukeshu (member of the Hikitsuke, a judicial body of the Muromachi period) was established on January 13, 1249.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 引付衆は御家人の所領関係訴訟（所務沙汰）を扱い、問注所ではその他の民事訴訟（雑務沙汰）及び訴訟雑務（主に訴状の受理）を扱うという役割分担がなされた。
sen.e: The responsibilities were divided between the Monchujo and Hikitsukeshu; Hikitsukeshu dealt with lawsuits brought about by gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods), whereas Monchu0dokoro handled other civil cases and serves at a court (mainly receiving petitions.).

Responsibilities were divided between the Monchujo and Hikitsukeshu; Hikitsukeshu dealt with lawsuits brought about by gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods), whereas Monchudokoro handled other civil cases and served within the court (mainly receiving petitions.).

Responsibilities were divided between the Monchujo and Hikitsukeshu; Hikitsukeshu dealt with Shomu-sata (lawsuits brought about by gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods)), whereas Monchu-dokoro handled Zatsumu-zata (other civil cases) and served within the court (mainly receiving petitions.).

sen.j: ちなみに刑事事件の取扱い（検断沙汰）は侍所が所管した。
sen.e: Samurai-dokoro (the Board of Retainers) handled Kendan-sata (criminal cases) or criminal cases. affairs
Samurai-dokoro (the Board of Retainers) handled Kendan-sata (criminal cases) or criminal cases. affairs
Samurai-dokoro (the Board of Retainers) handled Kendan-sata (criminal cases).
sen.cmt: 「or criminal cases. affairs」を削除しました。

sen.j: 以上の引付衆・問注所・侍所の所管地域は東国に限られており、西国については京の六波羅探題等が所管していた。
sen.e: The above Hikitsukeshu, Monchujo, and Samurai-dokoro handled cases occurred in Togoku (the eastern part of Japan, particularly Kanto region); Rokuhara Tandai (an administrative and judicial agency in Rokuhara, Kyoto) controlled cases in Saigoku (western part of Japan (esp. Kyushu, but ranging as far east as Kinki)

The above Hikitsukeshu, Monchujo, and Samurai-dokoro handled cases occurred in Togoku (the eastern part of Japan, particularly Kanto region); Rokuhara Tandai (an administrative and judicial agency in Rokuhara, Kyoto) controlled cases in Saigoku (western part of Japan (esp. Kyushu, but ranging as far east as Kinki)

The above mentioned Hikitsukeshu, Monchujo, and Samurai-dokoro handled cases that took place in Togoku (the eastern part of Japan, particularly the Kanto region); Rokuhara Tandai (an administrative and judicial agency in Rokuhara, Kyoto) controlled cases that took place in Saigoku (the western part of Japan).
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: すなわち問注所は東国の一般民事訴訟を取り扱っていたということになる。
sen.e: Therefore Monchujo handled general civil suits in Togoku.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Therefore Monchujo handled general civil suits in Togoku.
Therefore Monchujo handled general civil suits in Togoku.

sen.j: しかしそのうち鎌倉市中の一般民事訴訟については問注所ではなく政所が所管していた。
sen.e: However, not Monchusho but the government was responsible for general civil suits within Kamakura.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The government, and not Monchusho were responsible for general civil suits within Kamakura.
However, it was Mandokoro, and not Monchujo, which held jurisdiction over general civil suits within the city of Kamakura.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。Monchusho を Monchujo に修正しました。

tit.e: Kubodokoro in the Kenmu Restoration Period
Kubodokoro in the Kenmu Restoration Period
Kubodokoro in the Kenmu Restoration Period

sen.j: 建武の新政期において、その性格が不明な役所である「窪所」が設置されている。
sen.e: Kubodokoro, a government body whose function is unknown was established during the Kenmu Restoration Period.
Kubodokoro, a government body whose function is unknown was established during the Kenmu Restoration Period.
"Kubodokoro", a government body whose precise function is unknown, was established during the Kenmu Restoration Period.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。Kubodokoro にダブルクォーテーションを追記しました。

sen.j: これについて笠松宏至は、「窪」は草書体の「問注」を重ねた文字であるとして、訴訟受付機関であったとしている（警護所であったとする説もある）。
sen.e: Hiroshi KASAMATSU says that Kubodokoro was a place that was available for people to file lawsuits because the kanji of "kubo" comes from the overlapped kanji of "Monchu" in sosho (cursive script) style.

Hiroshi KASAMATSU says that Kubodokoro was a place that was available for people to file lawsuits because the kanji of "kubo" comes from the overlapped kanji of "Monchu" in sosho (cursive script) style.

According to Hiroshi KASAMATSU, the Kubodokoro was a place where people filed lawsuits, because the kanji character for "kubo" can be seen as the overlapped kanji characters for "monchu" written in the cursive script style (there is also a theory that the Kubodokoro was a station for security guards).
sen.cmt: 警護所はa station for security guardsと訳しました。FBに従って修正しました。ダブルクォーテーションを全角から半角に修正しました。

sen.j: 伊賀兼光・結城親光・高師直などが任命されている。
sen.e: Kanemitsu IGA, Chikamitsu YUKI, KO no Moroyo were appointed.
Kanemitsu IGA, Chikamitsu YUKI, KO no Moroyo were appointed.
The people such as Kanemitsu IGA, Chikamitsu YUKI, KO no Moronao were appointed to the post.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 室町幕府も当初は訴訟処理機関として問注所を設置したが、記録文書の管理や簡易訴訟のみを取り扱うにとどまった。
sen.e: The Muromachi Bakufu also established Monchujo as an agency that dealt with lawsuits in the beginning but later it only managed recorded document and handled summary lawsuits.
The Muromachi Bakufu also established Monchujo as an agency that dealt with lawsuits in the beginning but later changed it's function to manage the recording of documents and summaries of lawsuits..
At the beginning, the Muromachi bakufu established the Monchujo also as a body that dealt with lawsuits, but its function remained only to manage the recordings and summaries of lawsuits.
sen.cmt: FBに従って修正しました。

sen.j: 訴訟一般は、評定衆の下に置かれた引付が担当することとなった。
sen.e: Hikitsuke (judicial board) under Hyojoshu (a member of Council of State) took the responsibility for general lawsuits.
Hikitsuke (judicial board) under Hyojoshu (a member of Council of State) was responsible for general lawsuits.
Hikitsuke (judicial board) under Hyojoshu (a member of Council of State) was responsible for general lawsuits.
